page.title: 10HOME LIFE TODAY *****
page.content: Today,{electricity}plays an important part in running the home. Homes in the Dale contain{cookers; televisions; {freezers;refrigerators; irons;washing {machines;tumble driers;dishwashers and {video recorders}- all of which use electricity. In{Langthwaite village some people have solid fuel{Rayburn {stoves}and one cooks in a{fire oven.} Most people have a{telephone}and feel that it is important for emergency use in such an isolated dale. The majority of houses in this block are heated by an{open fire.} One home is heated by{oil central heating,}some by{solid fuel boiler}and one by {electric underfloor heating. In the past most{floors}in the houses were{stone flagged}which were then covered with{proggy or proddy mats. Today most homes have{fitted carpets.
